snippet: The Federal Trade Commission fined Google for privacy violations related to showing personalized ads to users of Apple’s Safari browser. It is the latest settlement in a crackdown on tech companies by the commission.
abstract: The Federal Trade Commission fined Google for privacy violations related to showing personalized ads to users of Apple’s Safari browser. It is the latest settlement in a crackdown on tech companies by the commission.

headline.main: F.T.C. Fines Google $22.5 Million for Safari Privacy Violations
headline.print_headline: Google, Accused of Skirting Privacy Provision, Is to Pay $22.5 Million to Settle Charges
